text.p: These are the main stories in Latvian newspapers on Friday. Prepared for Reuters by the Co-operation Fund. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Guntis Ulmanis met with the Latvian Ambassador to Russia Janis Peters and discussed a possible visit to Siberia in May to meet ethnic Latvians in the Krasnoyarsk region.
- The European Integration Programme of Latvia will be presented to the public next week.
- Under amendments to the law on compulsory insurance against unemployment, which took effect on January 1, some 200 thousand social tax dodgers may be left without benefits.

- Criminal police chief Aivars Valcis said attempts by Natalija Meisane who ran a modeling agency to enter the Russian fashion model market could have been a motives behind her murder last year. Her friend, Valery Machugin, a leading Latvian alcohol trader, was also murdered.
- President Guntis Ulmanis is planning to visit Turkey next month and pay a state visit to Poland in April. In the first half of 1997 Ulmanis might also visit France and Germany.
- Gasoline prices increased in 1997 by average 0.02 lats per litre and by 0.06 lats on diesel due to the annual increase in the excise rate.
- The State Bureau for human Rights registered 1,642 complaints lodged by Latvian residents last year, most of them concerning the activities of state officials.
